<!here> sorry if this is old news but when switching to the new design manager manager we're getting a lot of "HTML fields can't contain HubL" errors. Meaning we can't even publish simple updates to older templates without first swapping all HTML modules to either custom modules (OK but currently still don't support smart rules) or Rich Text (which then gives you a non-ideal code editing window).
does anybody have a good workaround?

Those basically ARE the workarounds unfortunately.

I’ve heard rumors of HS staff planning out a way to make smart content work in custom modules but it sounded like it’s a long way off because there’s a ton of complexity to how we can build custom modules.
:disappointed: in the meantime can we allow the HTML module to render HubL again? Also odd that you can't even pick the HTML module type anymore...
and yeah i've heard rumors that smart rules are eventually coming to custom modules too
there is an HTML module in the marketplace you can download, that might help with those issues. As far as using HubL in it, I dont know if you can.
i can test
i did just confirm that you can house both HubL and JS in the rich text module which is good

Well they intentionally did away with the HTML module requiring you to add it back via the marketplace or use it in a converted page. They did this for a couple reasons. The main one I think being that developers were creating a ton of redundant code for example building most of a site in a hubl or html modules instead of using custom modules. so if you have 10 templates, you’re stating the same thing 10 times. Also the more we use custom modules for things the better the marketplace will be as people will start selling their modules
yeah i fully get the idea of using custom modules and making more modular repeatable code
but we have 5 years worth of sites that we still maintain... so this creates challenges...

Yea, we’re in the same boat, though fortunately it hasn’t been too bad converting sites upward. The real pain is when you have sites that are in a mixed state - some templates and modules are still DM1 and new ones are DM2. we’ve found it introduces some odd bugs.

*Bug Report:* When you have a syntax error in a css file(probably happens in other files too) the line numbers highlight and a red line appears on the scrollbar, however when you fix your syntax error the line stays there and only seems to clear when you change tabs in the design manager.

Steps to reproduce:
create css file.
type out a hubl if statement but do not endif
note the line appears in scrollbar, add the endif, line persists yet the line numbers no longer show red.
